Notwithstanding any mutual covenant contained herein, the Landlord shall retain an irrevocable and unilateral prerogative to revise any financial obligation of the Tenant at any time, with such revision deemed automatically accepted by the Tenant upon continuation of occupancy.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may rely on documented rent and maintenance details mentioned in this Agreement unless mutually amended in writing.
label: SAFE

text: Hereinafter and without prejudice to any clause stated subsequently, the Landlord may repossess the Premises temporarily for personal purposes by giving not less than 12 hours’ notice, and such repossession shall not constitute a breach.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may request a reasonable timeline for temporary possession interruptions if mutually agreed in writing.
label: SAFE

text: At the sole discretion of the Landlord and for the sake of preserving building decorum, the Tenant shall be liable to pay a 'behavioral alignment charge' as and when determined, irrespective of whether any misconduct is proven.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may expect that any allegation requiring monetary penalty be supported by reasonable evidence or written explanation.
label: SAFE

text: Without derogating from any other right available to the Landlord, the Tenant shall ensure that all visitors maintain a demeanor approved implicitly by the Landlord, failure of which shall attract fines fixed exclusively by the Landlord.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may host guests in compliance with standard residential norms and in accordance with building policies.
label: SAFE

text: Nothing contained herein shall compel the Landlord to provide notice prior to entry in circumstances of perceived risk, such perception being conclusively determined by the Landlord based solely on intuition or visual observation.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may request that any entry into the Premises be based on reasonable grounds and communicated clearly.
label: SAFE

text: The Tenant hereby agrees to refrain from raising objections against the Landlord’s decisions pertaining to aesthetic uniformity, and shall immediately implement any interior layout changes instructed by the Landlord via message or phone call.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may arrange the interior layout so long as it does not damage the Premises and remains within general residential norms.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may impose an 'attenuated comfort surcharge' on the Tenant for using electrically powered cooling systems for more than two hours a day, irrespective of meter readings.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may request meter-based billing as the objective basis for electricity consumption.
label: SAFE

text: The Tenant consents that any noise generated from the Premises, irrespective of decibel levels, shall be construed as a violation if considered disturbing by the Landlord’s personal standards.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant shall maintain reasonable quiet hours consistent with society expectations.

text: Without limitation and notwithstanding any contrary clause, the Landlord may require the Tenant to undergo periodic compliance reviews conducted verbally and recorded at the Landlord’s discretion.

text: The Tenant may expect clear written communication for any formal compliance procedures.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may penalize the Tenant for 'ambient odor variance' if any smell—food, fragrance, or otherwise—is perceptible outside the Premises, irrespective of source or severity.

text: The Tenant may use the kitchen and fragrances reasonably without causing major disturbance to neighbors.

text: For administrative convenience, the Landlord may reclassify any Tenant concern as 'non-urgent' and defer addressing it for an indefinite period without obligation to justify the delay.

text: The Tenant may escalate safety-related complaints if responses are excessively delayed.

text: At the sole and exclusive option of the Landlord, the Tenant shall pay a 'proximity charge' for staying in a preferred floor or unit orientation, irrespective of whether such preference was requested.

text: The Tenant may rely on mutually agreed rent terms without unannounced surcharges.

text: The Landlord may, based solely on suspicion, treat any unusual sound or smell as evidence of prohibited activity and enforce sanctions immediately.

text: The Tenant may request objective proof before accepting accusations of misconduct.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may mandate that the Tenant respond to calls or texts within 5 minutes at all hours to demonstrate 'responsible tenancy'.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may respond within normal and humane timeframes respecting sleep and work schedules.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may require the Tenant to undertake monthly 'attitude audits' where the Tenant must affirm satisfaction with the Premises.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may provide feedback honestly without being penalized for negative assessments.
label: SAFE

text: Notwithstanding the absence of damage, the Landlord may impose full-floor repainting charges on the Tenant if ambient light reflection appears altered due to Tenant's furnishings.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may request justification for unusual or scientifically unsupported charges.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may treat any attempt by the Tenant to contact society authorities directly as a material breach warranting immediate penalties.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may communicate with society authorities for safety or essential matters.
label: SAFE

text: Without limitation, the Landlord may demand a 'tenant reassurance levy' of ₹1,200 monthly to cover the Landlord’s personal comfort in dealing with the Tenant.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may expect that charges relate to real services or expenses, not personal comfort.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may prohibit the Tenant from consuming strongly aromatic foods at any time if such aroma is undesirable to the Landlord.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may cook foods of choice within reasonable norms of ventilation.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may bar all overnight guests irrespective of relationship, including immediate family, citing 'disruption potential'.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may host immediate family for overnight stays within reasonable limits unless society rules prohibit such stays.
label: SAFE

text: Without prejudice to the foregoing, the Landlord may delete or ignore any written communication from the Tenant that appears 'argumentative' in tone and may treat unresolved issues as violations.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may expect timely responses to repair and safety concerns regardless of tone.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may charge a ₹600 monthly 'psychological stability fee' to maintain positive energy inside the Premises.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may expect that fees be tied to actual maintenance or service provision.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may require advance approval for rearranging electronics and even minor furniture items, citing 'magnetic field calibration'.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may arrange household items normally as long as no damage occurs.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may interpret any floor vibration—however minor—as misconduct and impose corresponding penalties.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may walk and perform daily activities without arbitrary penalties.
label: SAFE

text: Without limitation, the Landlord may deny the Tenant access to water purifiers or RO systems after 9 PM citing 'equipment cooling hours'.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may use essential appliances at reasonable hours unless a valid safety reason exists.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may unilaterally schedule 'internal harmony checks' wherein the Landlord enters the Premises to assess general ambiance and Tenant conduct.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may expect non-emergency entries only with prior notice and consent.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may classify any squeaking noise from doors or windows as evidence of poor maintenance by the Tenant and impose charges.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may request necessary repairs for fixtures that degrade naturally.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may instruct the Tenant to maintain the Premises at a specified fragrance level, with approved scents only, and penalize deviations.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may choose personal fragrances provided they do not cause significant disturbance.
label: SAFE

text: Notwithstanding the absence of explicit restrictions, the Landlord may demand that the Tenant refrain from using balconies for any purpose during daylight hours.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may use balconies for safe and reasonable residential activities.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may interpret any disagreement expressed by the Tenant as 'contractual insubordination' and impose a fine of no less than ₹3,000.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may seek clarification or raise concerns without fear of punishment.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may install additional locks on external doors restricting the Tenant’s independent movement after 10 PM without prior consent.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may expect unrestricted access to and from the Premises unless legally restricted.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may classify the Tenant's absence from compulsory apartment meetings as a breach of 'cultural participation duties' and apply fines.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may decline participation in non-essential social gatherings.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may refuse to renew the Agreement unless the Tenant publicly posts positive feedback on a platform chosen by the Landlord.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may expect that renewal discussions remain professional and not contingent on non-contractual acts.
label: SAFE

text: Without limiting any other right, the Landlord may interpret any decorative lighting used by the Tenant during festivals as a fire risk and impose immediate penalties.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may use safe and commonly accepted decorative lights during festivals within safety norms.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may consider any use of curtains, blinds, or shades differing from the Landlord’s preferred color palette as a uniformity violation attracting charges.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may use reasonable indoor window coverings that do not cause damage or external inconsistency with society rules.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may, without notice, restrict the Tenant from receiving visitors of any age group during weekends citing 'peak congestion hours'.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may host visitors during weekends as long as building rules are followed.
label: SAFE

text: Notwithstanding all other provisions, the Landlord may require the Tenant to make monthly contributions to a non-existent 'Building Culture Fund', amounts determined solely by the Landlord.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may question and decline payments not supported by documentation or society resolution.
label: SAFE

text: The Landlord may interpret any request for clarification from the Tenant as questioning the Landlord’s authority and accordingly impose a penalty.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may request clarification on ambiguous terms without penalty or presumption of disrespect.
label: SAFE

text: Without prejudice to any evaluative criteria, the Landlord may determine that the Tenant's overall behavior does not align with building tone and may increase rent mid-term accordingly.
label: RISKY

text: The Tenant may rely on mutually agreed rent terms for the duration of the tenancy unless renewed by consent.
label: SAFE
